title.narrative: 1.1 CHILD-SENSITIVE PLANNING

description.narrative: By 2016, strengthened child-sensitive planning, implementation, monitoring, and evaluation of socio-economic development outcomes, plans and programmes, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, a more effective national social protection system provides increased coverage, quality, and equitable access for the most vulnerable and disadvantaged groups

mailing-address.narrative: No. 81 A Tran Quoc Toan Ha Noi Viet Nam

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child marriage - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
Situation Analysis or Update on women and children
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, strengthened child-sensitive planning, implementation, monitoring, and evaluation of socio-economic development outcomes,plans and programmes

description.narrative: The capacities of senior officials from the ministries of Planning and Investment, Finance, Labour, Invalids and Social Affairs, Education and Training, and Health, as well as the National Assembly were further strengthened in the area of child-sensitive socio-economic development plans and public finance management. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Number of UNICEF focus provinces using the social audit tool as a source to inform provincial Socio-economic Development Plans and sectoral plans

actual.value: 2014:Two Citizen Reports Cards were completed and disseminated in Dien Bien and An Giang to assess the quality of commune and district public health services in these two provinces respectively. The local leaders (especially from the Health Sector) were committed to follow up on the Survey's findings and

title.narrative: Availability of a comprehensive national rights-based Situation Analysis on children in Viet Nam

baseline.value: 2010 Situation Analysis is available but not updated (2012)

actual.value: 2014:All the necessary arrangements for commencing the national SitAn were completed. These included recruitment of the research team (international and national consultants) and approval from the focal point ministry for the SitAn implementation.

title.narrative: The number of domains integrated in the calculation of multi-dimensional child poverty rate using Viet Nam Household Living Standards Survey data to better reflect the situation of children

actual.value: 2013:7 dimensions of child poverty were integrated in the calculation of multi-dimensional child poverty (MdCP) rate using Viet Nam Household Living Standards Survey (VHLSS) data. UNICEF successfully discussed and agreed with Ministry of Labour, Invalids and Social Affairs (MOLISA) and General Statistics

title.narrative: Availability of the completed Social Audit Toolkit that is disseminated to key government partners at national and provincial level by Ministry of Planning and Investment (MPI)

baseline.value: Social Audit Toolkit is not available (2012)

target.value: 2013:Social Audit Toolkit completed and disseminated to key partners (2013)

actual.value: 2013:The Social Audit Toolkit was completed and disseminated to key government partners at national and provincial level by MPI. As a result, three provinces of Dien Bien, Dong Thap and An Giang implemented social audits (Citizen Report Card tool) to assess health services at district and commune levels.
